com.ibm.team.repository.common
Interface IType

All Known Subinterfaces:
IHelperType, IItemType, IVirtualType
public interface IType

Represents a type of object found on the server. Types include auditable items (teams, contributors, workspaces, etc.), versionable items (files, folders), simple items and helpers . Since the repository schema is extensible, the set of types is open-ended.

Within a repository, type objects are singletons and could be compared for equality using equals() or ==.

Since:
0.5

NO_SIZE

static final long NO_SIZE
Deprecated. - This will be removed in 0.6 M3 - for validation use IPropertyConstraintValidator
See Also:
IType.getMaxSize(String), Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this type. A type is given a name by the party that a declares that type.

For built-in types, the names are the same as the ones found in the corresponding API interfaces minus the 'I' prefix. For example, the name of built-in contributor item type is "Contributor", corresponding to the interface IContributor.

The name of the type is also the base name for the EMF classes used to represent objects of this type.

Returns:
the name of the class; never null

getNamespaceURI

java.lang.String getNamespaceURI()
Returns the namespace URI for this type. The namespace URI is used to ensure that types declared by different providers are distinct even if they should happen to have the same name.

The namespace URI of the type is also that of the EMF package that contains the EMF classes used to represent objects of this type.

Returns:
the namespace URI for this type; never null

getMaxSize

long getMaxSize(java.lang.String propertyName)
Deprecated. IInternalItemValidator should be used instead. This method is too inaccurate for reasonable string validation. This will be removed in 0.6 M3

Returns the guaranteed maximum size of the given property.

For properties of type String, this method will return the guaranteed maximum number of characters allowed in the property value. For properties of type other than string, this method will return the constant value NO_SIZE.

Parameters:
propertyName - the property; must not be null
Returns:
guaranteed maximum size of property

isStringSmallEnough

boolean isStringSmallEnough(java.lang.String propertyName,
                            java.lang.String value)
Deprecated. use #validateStringProperty(String, String). This will be removed in 0.6 M3

Returns if the given string can be persisted for the given property. This method is a more precise form of the #getMaxSize(String)}

Parameters:
propertyName - the property; must not be null
value - the string that should be measured
Returns:
true if the string is small enough to fit under the given property

getAdapter

java.lang.Object getAdapter(java.lang.Class clazz)
Returns an object that adapts this type to the given class. The result can be cast to clazz.

This method is used to get at the special API for objects of this type when possible.

Pass EPackage.class to get reflective access to the underlying EMF package object (the one for the given getNamespaceURI()). From the EMF package one can navigate to the EMF classes within it.

Pass EClass.class to get reflective access to the underlying EMF class object.

Parameters:
clazz - the desired Java class; must not be null
Returns:
an instance of clazz, or null if this type could not be so adapted

isAbstract

boolean isAbstract()
Indicates if this type represents an abstract base class in the component model

Returns:
true if abstract; otherwise false
